com.google.code.siren4j.converter
Interface ResourceRegistry

All Known Implementing Classes:
ResourceRegistryImpl
public interface ResourceRegistry

The resource registry keeps a list of all Siren4J Resources as defined by their Siren4JEntity annotation. The name is used as the classname. The names therefore must be unique on the classpath.

Method Summary
 boolean containsClassEntry(Class<?> clazz)
          Determine if an entry exists for the given class.
 boolean containsEntityEntry(String entityName)
          Determine if an entry exists for the given entity name.

Method Detail

getClassByEntityName

Class<?> getClassByEntityName(String name)
Retrieve the class for the specified entity resource name.

Parameters:
name - the entity name, cannot be null or empty.
Returns:
the class for the entity name or null if not found.

getAllEntries

Map<String,Class<?>> getAllEntries()
Returns all entries in the registry.

Returns:
map of all entries, never null, may be empty.

containsEntityEntry

boolean containsEntityEntry(String entityName)
Determine if an entry exists for the given entity name.

Parameters:
entityName - cannot be null or empty.
Returns:
true if an entry was found.

containsClassEntry

boolean containsClassEntry(Class<?> clazz)
Determine if an entry exists for the given class.

Parameters:
clazz - cannot be null.
Returns:
true if an entry was found.

putEntry

void putEntry(String entityName,
              Class<?> clazz,
              boolean overwrite)
              throws Siren4JException
Puts an entry into the registry. This can also overwrite existing entries if the flag is set. This method is exposed for testing and edge cases and should be used with care.

Parameters:
entityName - cannot be null or empty.
clazz - cannot be null.
overwrite - if true then overwriting of an existing entry will be allowed, if false then an exception will be thrown if attempting to overwrite an existing entry.
Throws:
Siren4JException - if an overwrite is attempted and the flag is not true.
